file_content.text: Bas-Ton--I found a record of the Shining Man's visit to the shrine, but it's genetically locked.
Good thing you went tomb robbing. Sending the genetic workup on the Shining Man's ashes now.
My contacts didn't find any identity matches, by the way. No evidence he existed before Voss.
Whatever this conspiracy is, its people aren't careless. Keep looking.
That's not surprising.
What about the genetic code itself? Anything unusual?
Turn up anything else?
Not sure. Looks like there might've been some odd triggers built into his body--could explain the corpse decay.
Now's not a good time to report. I'm in a Mystic vault.
Save it for later.
Attempting to unlock the vitalicron now. Looping you in on the audio feed.
Interface activated. Warning: The memory is corrupted.
--came to us from the Nightmare Lands. You knew our ways. You bore a scroll.
I remember so little. What did the scroll say?
A prophecy from the Chamber of Ashes. It had been lost to us--
--die! Go back to the Nightmare Lands--
--grateful for your trust, but I must leave soon for Voss-Ka.
Trust does not matter. The prophecy you found speaks of you.
You are healed. You are the Shining Man.
Huh. Doesn't tell us why the Shining Man was sent here, but now we know how he conned the Voss.
He manufactured a prophecy somehow and came to the shrine to earn the Mystics' approval. Then on to Voss-Ka...
He fooled the Mystics.
...where the regular Voss learned to love him. What worries me is where he claims to have gotten that prophetic scroll.
I heard something about a prophetic scroll, the Mystics and the "Nightmare Lands."
Care to make sense of it?
I expected the Shining Man to be a little more... impressive.
He looked like a madman.
Maybe he's not lying about coming from the Nightmare Lands.
The Nightmare Lands are forbidden to the Voss--legend says the ruins drive people insane, and our scouts come back in parts.
Old ruins might be the only place he could find materials to fake a scroll of prophecy, but there's nowhere worse on the planet.
I solve the mystery of the Shining Man, I uncover a galactic conspiracy. I'm going to the Nightmare Lands.
He's important to the mission.
I want to know exactly where he's been.
Get me directions.
I'm tired of Voss legends getting in the way of my work. I'm going.
Sounds like superstition.
Then I'll dig up what I can, but we've got some prep work to do.
Meet me back at the teahouse. Bas-Ton out.
